source: What you need to know about the CORONAVIRUS or COVID-19
translated: Sá bɨn jálá ne lejwɛh dumo ne kolóna ne sóm wé ngʉ̂ KOSÓM-19 yí

source: SUMMARY
translated: TAGA MILɄ̂

source: - Coronavirus  - Vulnerable people - Symptoms - Transmission of coronavirus - How to protect yourself - What to do in case of contamination? - Definition of some difficult words
translated: - Kolóna ne sóm wé - Minjʉ̌m me lékwaa - Mendem  me lékwaa - Lenwɔɔla lé kolóna - Mpʉ mʉ̂r siŋá kɨya lekwaa laá yɨ́ - Mpʉ nya gó jálá sâ gó ó, bě ɨ́ si nwuɔ lé wá? - Micima mekǎn mé dí ɨ́ kɔbla má

source: Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.
translated: Lekwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé, dí ɨ́ lejɛ́baa ntâʼ kosóm-19, yé é, sóm jwɔ̂n. Wé atala nyɨ̂n é ɨ́ si bipum bédi ɨ lejêh besinwâ ɨ́ mbû betɔ́ɔ́sin bebá ne kam ne ɨbǔl, ɨ́ ngɔn mesio mé mbǔ wáá lelú lé mésio. Béndem  be tyɛ̂ mâ pʉná ne maá mé kœ́hœ́ mpyêb, lé sáá jʉ̂ mʉ̂r jɔɔ lé di ɨ sɨ bwɔʼ yɨ. Lɨ́ sɨ́ sɨ jamda í nsugo bipéh bí sɨ́ nyɔ̂ ɨnyɛ̂h. Sʉ́m lékwaa laá lé ajwiho yɨ, yé apǎ jwɛgaa.

source: Elderly person
translated: Pʉ́ra lémpǒm: mʉr di ɨ si jwim nyɔ́.

source: Person with a heart condition or disease
translated: Pʉ́ra mbá: mʉr di mbél lyém nyɔ́.

source: Vulnerable people People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.
translated: Minjʉ̌m me lékwaa  Bʉr bé dɨ ɨ́ lekwɛ̂h lenuwɔ lékwaa laá bá, bé é tááro ɨ́ bikéé to kumo ɨ minjʉ̌m bé ê nkul lenuwo sóm jwɔ̂n wáá. Minjʉ̌m ne bʉr be dí ne mekwaa mé á boobe má(mpʉ lekwaa lé kœhœ mpyêb, mpʉ lekwaa lé mesœh, mekwaa mé lyêm, lekwaa lé lyêm mʉ̂r di é puro mpâl lɨ́) bé é bé dí e buú kwɛ̂h lebwɨ lekwaa le sóm waá.

source: Fever Fatigue
translated: Pʉra lémpǒm Lejyoo letyɛʼ le nyʉ̌l

source: Dry cough Muscle aches and pains
translated: Pʉra mbá Kœhœ abe ne lentɔm mekwaa me nyʉ̂l

source: Symptoms The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.
translated: Mendem me lekwaa laá Mendem me lekwaa lé kolóna sóm mé mâ pwɨnaá ne mendem mé lekwaa lé kœhœ mpyêb: lejyóo, kœhœ abe ne lentɔm, lekwaa le nyʉ̂l nyɨnyɛ̂h, metyɛʼ me nyʉ̂l. Mʉ́ʉ́ mimbêl mé ɨ́ lejwôʼ mekwaa me nyʉ̂l, miku mi dʉ́ ɨ́ lekwɛ̂l diblɨ́ akǎ swôh mbɨmbɨya, dʉ́ ɨ́ leswol nkʉ̂nsele, ngolo-ngolo ɨ́ lekwaa, nkʉ́ nkumlo bʉ̂r, bé mʉ̂ ne lekwaa bá, mendem me nɨ̌ mé abe ɨ́ lemɛ̂r bé, be ma jwɨʼ é bé é mpœʼœ. Bʉ́ʉ́ bʉ̂r ɨ́ sɔmá bʉ̂r báá bé ma cigo ó abe ne ngúma dʉ̂m.

source: Person with a cough
translated: Pʉ́ra ʉr di ɨ́ lekœ̂h nyɔ́

source: Transmission of coronavirus COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.
translated: Lenwɔɔla lé kolóna  Lenuwala le kolóna ne sóm wé nkʉ kosóm-19 yɨ ma nuwola á ne bʉr bé di ne sóm tyɛ̂ʼ bá. Jɔɔ mbél tyɛ̂ dí ɨ́ kœ̂h ne letœœ yi, bwɔ métó mé métyêl mé é ɨ́ lepwɔ̂l nyé ɨ́ dʉ̂ ne num.                                         Metó mé metyêl máá mé é ni gó ɨ́ dʉ ne num wá, go ntâʼ nuwɔ lekwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé.Sâ gwɔ́r é, mʉ̂r é kʉ́na ne sá di ne metó né metyêl maá maá wá, ntâʼ kúna ne mbó tyɛ̂ ɨ́ mîh, dʉ̂, ne num wá nye é bɛ̂m nuwɔ́ lékwaá láá.

source: How to protect yourself
translated: Mɨná síŋá kɨ́ŋ lékwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé nyá ɛ̂?

source: 1. Avoid touching eyes, nose, mouth.
translated: 1. Pʉra lempom: akúna ne mîh, ne dʉ̂, ne num.

source: 2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.
translated: 2. Pʉra mbá: léjwɨɨ le membô ne sɔbô ɨ́ medibo mé dí legʉ̂ má. Mpie tyɛ̂ ntâʼ tin membô ne tawala dí swohla yí.

source: 3. Cough and sneeze into the crook of your arm.
translated: 3. Pʉra lɛ̂l: go kœ̂h ne tœœ é ɨ́ niʼɨ̌ mbó gô.

source: 4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.
translated: 4. Pʉra nâ: ade tír bɨ̂h ne lekúna ne betír bé dí ɨ́ lekubla bá.

source: 5. Keep at least one meter away from a person who is cou- ghing or sneezing.
translated: 5. Pʉra tɛ̂n: tyɛ̂b ɨ́ ncɛrǎ tyé mɛ́ra ngwɔ́r ɨ́ mʉr di lekœ̂h nkʉ̂ ɨ́ letœœ nyɔ́.

source: 6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.
translated: 6. Pʉra saman: kɨ́ŋ leswo mʉ̂r ne mbô. Swoh mʉ̂r ne mɨʼɨ̌ lʉ̂ nkʉ́ ne num.

source: 7. Avoid gatherings.
translated: 7. Pʉra nsaamgba: bʉr adi mentumo mentumo.

source: 8. Restrict movement.
translated: 8. Pʉra mwom: akǎ buú kœ̂ʼ.

source: 9. Keep informed and verify the source of information.
translated: 9. Pʉra ɨbǔl: wá jwɛ̂ʼ lejwoʼlo milɔɔ́ ne mempáŋlo ne le wá pahlo súm mílɔɔ ne mempáŋlo máá di ɨ́ lejwiho yɨ́.

source: What to do in case of contamination? If you have symptoms: - Avoid contact with other people. - Stay at home. - Call 1510 and follow the doctor's instructions. Other possible numbers:
translated: Wáa mbi sɔ́ʼɔ̌ mʉ̂r dí ne nkul lesǎ ɨ́ jɔɔ nyé di ɨ́ nuwɔ lékwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé yí ɛ̂?  Gó ó bě í sí jwɔ́ra mendem wá: - Akǎ bálǎ kúna ne bʉr dǐ bii yô ba. - Jyêb 1510 í kúl mémpáŋlo gô goo dú miyeʼlá bejwii be dɔ́brɔ.  Bʉ́ʉ́ benɔmo be dí ɨ́ jalaá go jyébaa bá:

source: To date, there is no cure for COVID-19, but authorities are continuing research to find a suitable treatment. Everyone must be responsible and take the right steps to protect themselves and those around them.
translated: Ɨ melú mâʼá mwɨr wé apǎ nyɨ̌n waa di ne nkul lejwom kosóm-19, sâ gwór é jwii yé é ɨ́ leto ne lesáa dʉ̂m lé dí jala ne lekwaa laá lɨ́.  Mʉr e mʉr jaĺa ledil ne lesà bésʉ́sʉ́ú be mbɛh bʉr wé.

source: Definition of some difficult words  Asthma: chronic lung disorder Contamination: infection Diabetes: disease that occurs when the body can't use glucose normally Flu: cough, influenza Infected: affected, touched Infection: disease Instructions: direction, information Patient: person under health care Pre-existing conditions: long-term disease Runny nose: excess nasal drainage Symptoms: signs of illness Treatment: cure, medication Virus: disease agent Vulnerable: defenseless, exposed
translated: Micimǎ mékǎn mé di ɨ́ kɔbla má.  Siló bʉʼ: lekwaa lé bipupul lé di abe ne nkul lesio lɨ́. Metɨ́ɨ́: nkuêl, metɨ́ɨ́. Lekwaa lé lébuwo lé kwoʼó ɨ nyʉ̂l. Jɔɔ́ nkwoʼó di ɨ́ buwo ɨ́ nyʉ́l yi. Mɔ́ʼɔ́: leswol le dʉ̂(jɔɔ dʉ̂ di ɨ́ leswol yi) Jɔɔ gó di ɨ́ si nʉwɔ lekwaa yi: go mʉ̂ é mbêl/ Kœhœ: kœhœ di ɨ́ ledibo dʉ̂ yi. Lekwaa lé lyém mʉ̂r di ɨ́ lepʉro mpâl lɨ: lepuro lé mpâl mâ táalo ó ɨ́ mpuwo metyo lyêm di ɨ́ lelwoʼlo ɨ́ misiho yi. Mbwihá ɨ́ lekwaa: mʉ̀r di ɨ́ si nuwɔ lekwaa nyɔ́. Jɔɔ gó di ne lekwaa yí Lekwwa: búbúwa Mbêl: mʉ̂r di ɨ́ lejwôʼ lekwaa nyɔ́ Kulanjyɛ̌n: jɔɔ yɨyɛ̂h, jwɨ́ʼ gwɔ́r, asyɛ́ɛ́la tɨ to tóʼ. Mʉ̂r di é kwɛ̂h lé dwoʼra lekwaa nyɔ́.                        Mendem me lekwaa: mpu lekwaa dié sâ yi Dǔm: mɨr, ɨ lejwǒm lékwaa Sôm: sâ dié jê mʉ̂r lekwaa yi Mʉ̂r di cyɛʼ meciyo nyɔ́: kam é kam ɨ lenuwo lekwaa.

source: What you need to know about the CORONAVIRUS or COVID-19    What you need to know about the CORONAVIRUS or COVID-19                           SUMMARY - Coronavirus  - Vulnerable people - Symptoms - Transmission of coronavirus - How to protect yourself - What to do in case of contamination? - Definition of some difficult words     p.2 p.3 p.4 p.5 p.6 p.7   p.8 Coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, is a new virus. It was first reported in China on 31 December 2019. It has flu-like symptoms and can cause death in some severe cases. It is widespread in many countries around the world. The origin of the disease is not yet known.   Elderly person  Person with a heart condition or disease Vulnerable people People of all ages can become infected with this new virus. The elderly and people with pre-existing conditions (such as asthma, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure) seem more likely to become seriously ill from this virus.   Fever Fatigue  Dry cough Muscle aches and pains Symptoms The symptoms of a coronavirus infection are similar to those of the flu: fever, dry cough, muscle aches, fatigue. Some patients have pain, nasal congestion, runny nose, sore throat, or diarrhea. Some people, although infected, have no symptoms and feel fine. Most people recover without needing any special treatment.  Person with a cough Transmission of coronavirus COVID-19 is transmitted by people carrying the virus. When a sick person coughs or sneezes, they expel droplets through their nose or mouth. If a person breathes in these droplets, they can become infected with the coronavirus. If a person touches an object infected with these droplets and then touches their eyes, nose or mouth, they can also become infected.     How to protect yourself 1. Avoid touching eyes, nose, mouth.  2. Wash your hands frequently with soap and running water. Then dry them with a clean towel.  3. Cough and sneeze into the crook of your arm.   4. Avoid eating raw meat and touching live animals.     5. Keep at least one meter away from a person who is cou- ghing or sneezing.   6. Avoid shaking hands. Greet each other with a nod or a verbal greeting.  7. Avoid gatherings.   8. Restrict movement.  9. Keep informed and verify the source of information. What to do in case of contamination? If you have symptoms: - Avoid contact with other people. - Stay at home. - Call 1510 and follow the doctor's instructions. Other possible numbers:  699 279 622 675 308 373 698 423 929 655 728 884 670 713 979  699 933 725 677 429 357 699 986 740 676 466 797 670 113 761  To date, there is no cure for COVID-19, but authorities are continuing research to find a suitable treatment. Everyone must be responsible and take the right steps to protect themselves and those around them. Definition of some difficult words  Asthma: chronic lung disorder Contamination: infection Diabetes: disease that occurs when the body can't use glucose normally Flu: cough, influenza Infected: affected, touched Infection: disease Instructions: direction, information Patient: person under health care Pre-existing conditions: long-term disease Runny nose: excess nasal drainage Symptoms: signs of illness Treatment: cure, medication Virus: disease agent Vulnerable: defenseless, exposed
translated: Sá bɨn jálá ne lejwɛh dumo ne kolóna ne sóm wé ngʉ̂ KOSÓM-19 yí    Sá bɨn jálá ne lejwɛh dumo ne kolóna ne sóm wé ngʉ̂ KOSÓM-19 yí                                TAGA MILɄ̂  - Kolóna ne sóm wé - Minjʉ̌m me lékwaa - Mendem  me lékwaa - Lenwɔɔla lé kolóna - Mpʉ mʉ̂r siŋá kɨya lekwaa laá yɨ́ - Mpʉ nya gó jálá sâ gó ó, bě ɨ́ si nwuɔ lé wá? - Micima mekǎn mé dí ɨ́ kɔbla má     p.2 p.3 p.4 p.5 p.6 p.8  p.9 Lekwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé, dí ɨ́ lejɛ́baa ntâʼ kosóm-19, yé é, sóm jwɔ̂n. Wé atala nyɨ̂n é ɨ́ si bipum bédi ɨ lejêh besinwâ ɨ́ mbû betɔ́ɔ́sin bebá ne kam ne ɨbǔl, ɨ́ ngɔn mesio mé mbǔ wáá lelú lé mésio. Béndem  be tyɛ̂ mâ pʉná ne maá mé kœ́hœ́ mpyêb, lé sáá jʉ̂ mʉ̂r jɔɔ lé di ɨ sɨ bwɔʼ yɨ. Lɨ́ sɨ́ sɨ jamda í nsugo bipéh bí sɨ́ nyɔ̂ ɨnyɛ̂h. Sʉ́m lékwaa laá lé ajwiho yɨ, yé apǎ jwɛgaa.    Pʉ́ra lémpǒm: mʉr di ɨ si jwim nyɔ́.  Pʉ́ra mbá: mʉr di mbél lyém nyɔ́. Minjʉ̌m me lékwaa  Bʉr bé dɨ ɨ́ lekwɛ̂h lenuwɔ lékwaa laá bá, bé é tááro ɨ́ bikéé to kumo ɨ minjʉ̌m bé ê nkul lenuwo sóm jwɔ̂n wáá. Minjʉ̌m ne bʉr be dí ne mekwaa mé á boobe má(mpʉ lekwaa lé kœhœ mpyêb, mpʉ lekwaa lé mesœh, mekwaa mé lyêm, lekwaa lé lyêm mʉ̂r di é puro mpâl lɨ́) bé é bé dí e buú kwɛ̂h lebwɨ lekwaa le sóm waá.   Pʉra lémpǒm Lejyoo letyɛʼ le nyʉ̌l  Pʉra mbá Kœhœ abe ne lentɔm mekwaa me nyʉ̂l Mendem me lekwaa laá Mendem me lekwaa lé kolóna sóm mé mâ pwɨnaá ne mendem mé lekwaa lé kœhœ mpyêb: lejyóo, kœhœ abe ne lentɔm, lekwaa le nyʉ̂l nyɨnyɛ̂h, metyɛʼ me nyʉ̂l. Mʉ́ʉ́ mimbêl mé ɨ́ lejwôʼ mekwaa me nyʉ̂l, miku mi dʉ́ ɨ́ lekwɛ̂l diblɨ́ akǎ swôh mbɨmbɨya, dʉ́ ɨ́ leswol nkʉ̂nsele, ngolo-ngolo ɨ́ lekwaa, nkʉ́ nkumlo bʉ̂r, bé mʉ̂ ne lekwaa bá, mendem me nɨ̌ mé abe ɨ́ lemɛ̂r bé, be ma jwɨʼ é bé é mpœʼœ. Bʉ́ʉ́ bʉ̂r ɨ́ sɔmá bʉ̂r báá bé ma cigo ó abe ne ngúma dʉ̂m.  Pʉ́ra ʉr di ɨ́ lekœ̂h nyɔ́ Lenwɔɔla lé kolóna  Lenuwala le kolóna ne sóm wé nkʉ kosóm-19 yɨ ma nuwola á ne bʉr bé di ne sóm tyɛ̂ʼ bá. Jɔɔ mbél tyɛ̂ dí ɨ́ kœ̂h ne letœœ yi, bwɔ métó mé métyêl mé é ɨ́ lepwɔ̂l nyé ɨ́ dʉ̂ ne num.                                         Metó mé metyêl máá mé é ni gó ɨ́ dʉ ne num wá, go ntâʼ nuwɔ lekwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé.Sâ gwɔ́r é, mʉ̂r é kʉ́na ne sá di ne metó né metyêl maá maá wá, ntâʼ kúna ne mbó tyɛ̂ ɨ́ mîh, dʉ̂, ne num wá nye é bɛ̂m nuwɔ́ lékwaá láá.     Mɨná síŋá kɨ́ŋ lékwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé nyá ɛ̂? 1. Pʉra lempom: akúna ne mîh, ne dʉ̂, ne num.   2. Pʉra mbá: léjwɨɨ le membô ne sɔbô ɨ́ medibo mé dí legʉ̂ má. Mpie tyɛ̂ ntâʼ tin membô ne tawala dí swohla yí.   3. Pʉra lɛ̂l: go kœ̂h ne tœœ é ɨ́ niʼɨ̌ mbó gô.  4. Pʉra nâ: ade tír bɨ̂h ne lekúna ne betír bé dí ɨ́ lekubla bá.     5. Pʉra tɛ̂n: tyɛ̂b ɨ́ ncɛrǎ tyé mɛ́ra ngwɔ́r ɨ́ mʉr di lekœ̂h nkʉ̂ ɨ́ letœœ nyɔ́.   6. Pʉra saman: kɨ́ŋ leswo mʉ̂r ne mbô. Swoh mʉ̂r ne mɨʼɨ̌ lʉ̂ nkʉ́ ne num.   7. Pʉra nsaamgba: bʉr adi mentumo mentumo.  8. Pʉra mwom: akǎ buú kœ̂ʼ.  9. Pʉra ɨbǔl: wá jwɛ̂ʼ lejwoʼlo milɔɔ́ ne mempáŋlo ne le wá pahlo súm mílɔɔ ne mempáŋlo máá di ɨ́ lejwiho yɨ́. Wáa mbi sɔ́ʼɔ̌ mʉ̂r dí ne nkul lesǎ ɨ́ jɔɔ nyé di ɨ́ nuwɔ lékwaa lé kolóna ne sóm wé yí ɛ̂?  Gó ó bě í sí jwɔ́ra mendem wá: - Akǎ bálǎ kúna ne bʉr dǐ bii yô ba. - Jyêb 1510 í kúl mémpáŋlo gô goo dú miyeʼlá bejwii be dɔ́brɔ.  Bʉ́ʉ́ benɔmo be dí ɨ́ jalaá go jyébaa bá:  699 279 622 675 308 373 698 423 929 655 728 884 670 713 979   699 933 725 677 429 357 699 986 740 676 466 797 670 113 761  Ɨ melú mâʼá mwɨr wé apǎ nyɨ̌n waa di ne nkul lejwom kosóm-19, sâ gwór é jwii yé é ɨ́ leto ne lesáa dʉ̂m lé dí jala ne lekwaa laá lɨ́.  Mʉr e mʉr jaĺa ledil ne lesà bésʉ́sʉ́ú be mbɛh bʉr wé. Micimǎ mékǎn mé di ɨ́ kɔbla má.  Siló bʉʼ: lekwaa lé bipupul lé di abe ne nkul lesio lɨ́. Metɨ́ɨ́: nkuêl, metɨ́ɨ́. Lekwaa lé lébuwo lé kwoʼó ɨ nyʉ̂l. Jɔɔ́ nkwoʼó di ɨ́ buwo ɨ́ nyʉ́l yi. Mɔ́ʼɔ́: leswol le dʉ̂(jɔɔ dʉ̂ di ɨ́ leswol yi) Jɔɔ gó di ɨ́ si nʉwɔ lekwaa yi: go mʉ̂ é mbêl/ Kœhœ: kœhœ di ɨ́ ledibo dʉ̂ yi. Lekwaa lé lyém mʉ̂r di ɨ́ lepʉro mpâl lɨ: lepuro lé mpâl mâ táalo ó ɨ́ mpuwo metyo lyêm di ɨ́ lelwoʼlo ɨ́ misiho yi. Mbwihá ɨ́ lekwaa: mʉ̀r di ɨ́ si nuwɔ lekwaa nyɔ́. Jɔɔ gó di ne lekwaa yí Lekwwa: búbúwa Mbêl: mʉ̂r di ɨ́ lejwôʼ lekwaa nyɔ́ Kulanjyɛ̌n: jɔɔ yɨyɛ̂h, jwɨ́ʼ gwɔ́r, asyɛ́ɛ́la tɨ to tóʼ. Mʉ̂r di é kwɛ̂h lé dwoʼra lekwaa nyɔ́.                        Mendem me lekwaa: mpu lekwaa dié sâ yi Dǔm: mɨr, ɨ lejwǒm lékwaa Sôm: sâ dié jê mʉ̂r lekwaa yi Mʉ̂r di cyɛʼ meciyo nyɔ́: kam é kam ɨ lenuwo lekwaa.
